intro: Tripterygium regelii var. doianum, commonly known as the Chinese thunder god vine, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into fleshy, red berries. It contains various bioactive compounds, including triterpenoids, which have been studied for their medicinal properties. Due to its toxic nature, it is often used in traditional medicine with caution.
